Today, Dan and Jordan continue to view Alex's Uvalde shooting coverage.  In this installment, Alex implores the audience to not blame the police for anything, and workshops ways to make schools more like jails with a guy who used to work for Blackwater.

==Detailed Show Notes==

Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2022/6/5/episode-689-may-26-2022 Episode #689: May 26, 2022]</ref>:

*Alex's continued coverage of the aftermath of the Uvalde shooting
*Alex relies on some anonymously sourced information delivered by his head of security Tim Enlow to report that the shooting was not a school shooting, but was actually a hostage situation that led to murders
*Some of Enlow's details do coincide with information that would be revealed on May 27th, at the [https://www.npr.org/2022/06/03/1102689126/uvalde-shooting-police-response press conference held by Col. McCraw]
*[https://www.rethinktokyo.com/sites/default/files/gl-2021-cost-of-living-city-ranking-mercer-0622.pdf Living in Chicago is more expensive] than any city in Luxembourg
*Alex is wrong about many of the [https://www.npr.org/2017/11/30/567477160/how-the-loss-of-u-s-psychiatric-hospitals-led-to-a-mental-health-crisis dynamics surrounding the erosion] of [https://origins.osu.edu/article/americas-long-suffering-mental-health-system?language_content_entity=en mental health resources in the country]
*[https://www.nber.org/papers/w23510 NBER study] about the effect of right-to-carry laws
*[https://ajph.aphapublications.org/doi/full/10.2105/AJPH.2013.301409 AJPH study] about the effect of increased gun ownership
